item.title: Rubbish dumped on street, 3rd September
item.description:
These bags have been on the street since Saturday. There is also another black bag across the street which has been dumped by someone. Please can we have street cleaners on Leighton and Ladbroke Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Leighton Road, Southbury, London

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Abandoned cars utilising free parking, 3rd September
item.description:
A black car has been left parked in the same free parking bay for at least six months without moving. This takes up valuable space in an area where free parking is already very limited. It appears the vehicle is abandoned or unused, which is unfair to other residents and workers who rely on these bays. In addition, there is a rusty old American vehicle that has remained in the same spot for over a year. Both vehicles seem to be occupying free parking long-term without being used, reducing availability for genuine users.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Craigton Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 3rd September
item.description:
This drain has been blocked many times but today it is clearly a hazard. This street suffered badly from the 2021 floods and all the basements on the road flooded. Can this drain be looked at properly and ASAP? Is this due to the current pavement works which have been going on for over a month?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Widley Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 2 & 4 Camden Park Road NW19BG, 3rd September
item.description:
Pavement completely.blocked by overgrown and low hanging tree from the gardens of 2 & 4 Camden Park Road NW19BG. There is a lamppost there and pedestrians, wheelchair users and prams cannot get past and have to walk in the road. If there is a car parked there they have to walk around it in a live lane of traffic. Please resolve asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camden Mews, Tufnell Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
